modules.description: This module processes OCaml abstract syntax trees to transform implementations by analyzing and restructuring variable bindings and module contexts. It builds expressions representing lists and qualified module identifiers, extracts variable names, and traverses AST nodes to maintain environment state during transformations. It is used to modify code at compile time, such as generating boilerplate or rewriting expressions based on lexical scoping rules.

Stores and processes input phrases in a buffer, runs the OCaml toplevel read-eval-print loop, and locates initialization files. Uses a mutable buffer for accumulating input and interacts directly with the OCaml compiler's parsing and evaluation system. Useful for embedding interactive OCaml sessions or customizing the toplevel environment startup.

This module provides terminal interaction utilities for embedding OCaml sessions, featuring boxed output rendering, file evaluation with context control, and a customizable REPL loop with history and prompt support. It defines the `value` type for structured data representation and uses a mutable buffer to process input phrases, interface with the OCaml compiler, and locate initialization files. You can use it to run interactive toplevel sessions with syntax highlighting, execute scripts with precise location tracking, or customize environment startup behavior. Submodule functionality enables low-level control over input accumulation, evaluation, and session configuration.
